intro: Fimbristylis kernii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Australia and is typically found in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as swampy areas and margins of water bodies. The plant has grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers that are often inconspicuous. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Fimbristylis kernii is generally short-lived and has a limited distribution within its native range.
